etymology.description: 山(山) (shān, "mountain") + 要(要) (yào, phonetic) = mountain terrain -> difficult, arduous
etymology.interpretation: The character combines 山(山) (shān, "mountain"), representing mountain terrain, with 要(要) (yào) for phonetic value. This reflects how mountainous landscapes are often challenging and arduous to traverse.

examples.chinese: 这条路崾险难行(這條路崾險難行)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè tiáo lù yǎo xiǎn nán xíng.
examples.english: This road is arduous and treacherous.

examples.chinese: 他毅然踏上崾途(他毅然踏上崾途)，追逐梦想不言放弃(追逐夢想不言放棄)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yìrán tà shàng yǎo tú, zhuīzhú mèngxiǎng bù yán fàngqì.
examples.english: He resolutely embarked on an arduous journey, relentlessly chasing his dreams.
